title: Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Next Generation
summary: A group of teenagers get into a car crash in the Texas woods on prom night, and then wander into an old farmhouse that is home to Leatherface and his insane family of cannibalistic psychopaths.
critic_reviews: Manages the difficult feat of being genuinely scary and sharply self-satirical all at once.
Bits and pieces of the story will, on occasion, leave you scratching your head but it, nevertheless, moves rapidly enough to keep you scurrying to keep pace with the new business at hand.

Its own efforts to be tongue-in-cheek, as with a backwoods gunman who quotes Emerson and Machiavelli, fall seriously flat. But should anyone have the patience to look closely, the two leading players do show signs of what would soon make them famous.
Henkel's directing debut isn't incompetent: It's just derivative, pointless and tediously repetitive.
A slightly above-average slasher film that's only partially redeemed by small but endearingly loopy shreds of black humor.
The movie recapitulates the absurdist tabloid-redneck comedy of the great, original Chainsaw without a hint of its primal terror.
The bottom line is that the only Texas Chainsaw Massacre movie that you need is to see is the first.

reviews.content: It's the kind of movie that nearly qualifies for a "So bad, It's good" kind of film. I think it's just freaking awful though. Worth watching to rip on it but totally irredeemable.
This movie is the most horrible movie in history. The acting sucks, the kills are horrible, and everyone was stupid.

This review contains spoilers, click expand to view.
        
Besides Jenny and Darla, the other characters are awful and/or underdeveloped.The kills are very boring, the Illuminati stuff is ridiculous, and the story is so similar to the original.

Finally the worst one in the franchise, and not only in the franchise but Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Next Generation just became my new pick for the worst movie i've ever seen, the movie is terribly written, terribly produced, horriblyFinally the worst one in the franchise, and not only in the franchise but Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Next Generation just became my new pick for the worst movie i've ever seen, the movie is terribly written, terribly produced, horribly performed, and there is literally zero thing on this movie that i like, the look of Leatherface in this one is just the worst thing ever and his/her scream is even worst, all the actor and the actresses performance in this movie is one of, if not the worst performances i've ever seen, they're so annoying and they're stupid, Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Next Generation is just so frustrating to watch and if it's not because of the franchise i already stop in the first 10 minutes of the film, it's a horrible horrible experience.

The setup may be different but the middle is so similar to the original its a little jarring. Getting the "alright, alright, alright" from McConaughey was a big eye roll moment. Final act was incomprehensible, the plane for example??? Also IThe setup may be different but the middle is so similar to the original its a little jarring. Getting the "alright, alright, alright" from McConaughey was a big eye roll moment. Final act was incomprehensible, the plane for example??? Also I don't think a single person actually got Chain Sawed.
